title: Here's a curated reading list of 20 articles up to 2023 that focus on complex reasoning in natural language processing (NLP
note: with an emphasis on pretrained language models (PLMs):

title: Pre-training of Deep Bidirectional Transformers for Language Understanding"** - Devlin et al

author.literal: **"Attention is All You Need"** - Vaswani et al.

title: **"GPT-3: Language Models are Few-Shot Learners"**
**"RoBERTa: A Robustly Optimized BERT Pretraining Approach"** - Liu et al
**"XLNet: Generalized Autoregressive Pretraining for Language Understanding"** - Yang et al
**"T5: Exploring the Limits of Transfer Learning with a Unified Text-to-Text Transformer"**
Pre-training Text Encoders as Discriminators Rather Than Generators"**
**"ALBERT: A Lite BERT for Self-supervised Learning of Language Representations"**
**"UnifiedQA: Crossing Format Boundaries with a Single QA System"**
**"DeBERTa: Decoding-enhanced BERT with Disentangled Attention"** - He et al
**"Language Models as Knowledge Bases?"** - Petroni et al
Analyzing the Knowledge of Language Models"** - Petroni et al
Bridging Language Models and Knowledge Graphs with Relation Extraction"**
**"Compositional Generalization by Learning Analytical Expressions"** - Li et al
**"Reasoning Over Paths via Knowledge Base Completion"** - Bordes et al
**"Neural Module Networks"**
Retrieval-Augmented Generation for Knowledge-Intensive NLP Tasks"**

author.literal: **"Self-Supervised Learning of Pretext-Invariant Representations"** - Misra et al.

title: **"Towards Reasoning in Large Language Models: A Survey"**
**"Chain of Thought Prompting Elicits Reasoning in Large Language Models"**

These articles cover a range of topics related to pretrained language models, including their architecture, training methods, and applications in complex reasoning tasks. They provide a solid foundation for understanding the current state of the art in NLP and the role of PLMs in advancing the field
